intro: Coussarea loftonii subsp. loftonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
